lines.text: Boy, you people sure stay up late.
We keep odd hours.
Howdy. I'm gonna separate your head from your shoulders. Hope you don't mind none.
Where are we, Diamondback? What road is this?
You got me.
Isn't that where I had the flat tire? You pulled over.
And there you stood by the side of that road... and I just knew you were trouble.
And you were right.
[both chuckling]
Caleb, those people back there, they wasn't normal. Normal folks, they don't spit out bullets when you shoot 'em, no sir.
How old are you?
I fought for the South.
South?
We lost.
[chuckles]
Look, I'll take care of him!
You can't, Mae. I turned you, I taught you.
Well I turned him and I can teach him!

[smirking]
What's the matter, Homer? You jealous? A little too little to be jealous.
You have any idea what it's like to be a big man on the inside and have a small body on the outside?
You have ANY idea what it's like to HEAR about it every NIGHT?
I hate 'em when they ain't been shaved.
I taught Severen everything he knew, but not everything I know.
[Pale, sweating and in obvious withdrawal, Caleb is being shaken down by a policeman]
You ain't looking too good, son.
I ain't feeling too good, sir.
What're you on?
You wouldn't believe me...
The light that's leaving that star right now will take a billion years to get down here. You want to know why you've never met a girl like me before?
Yeah. Why?
Because I'll still be here when the light from that star gets down here to earth in a billion years.
What the hell's eatin' you?

[Chuckles]
Your mama.
You wish.
I wish I may, I wish I might. Wish I was a thousand miles from here tonight.
Sure was some kiss.

[after shooting in the head a truck driver]
Bull's-eye!
I sure haven't met any girls like you.
No. No, you sure haven't.
Cut the shit. I know you're awake. I can smell it.
What you people want?
Just a couple more minutes of your time, about the same duration as the rest of your life.
There's somethin' I want to show you.
[Caleb and Mae get off the truck]
There's somethin' you want to show me?
Yeah. The night.
What about it?
It's dark.
I noticed.
It's so bright, it'll blind you.
I can't see.
Well, listen. Do you hear it?
I'm listenin'. I don't hear nothin'.
Listen hard. Do you hear it?
Hear what?
The night, it's deafening.
Hey, Jesse, remember that fire we started in Chicago?
Caleb, fasten your fuckin' seat belt!
[laughs maniacally]
I'm your worst fuckin' nightmare. Severen.
And I'm Homer. That's H-O-M-E-R. Mispronounce it and I wouldn't wanna be you
How you doin', Jess?
Like shit! How 'bout you?
I'm down to my last inch of skin!
What the fuck is goin' on?
It ain't what's goin' on, son. It's what's comin' off. Your face. Clean off.

[sucking blood off his fingers]
It's finger-lickin' GOOD!
[first lines]

[crushing a mosquito]
Dumb suck.
[last lines]
Caleb, what's happening?
I brought you home.
I'm afraid.
Don't be. It's just the sun.

[Homer is staring at Sarah]
It's impolite to stare.
You didn't get me a beer, did you?
You're gonna have to support your own bad habits.
Can I have a bite?
Bite?
I'm just dyin' for a cone.
Dyin'?
Who you out here with?
Friends.
Boyfriend?
Friends.
I mean, I don't have a girlfriend.
That's too bad.
Exactly.
Horses just don't like me.
Let me do it, Jesse. Let me tap dance on him, won't ya?
We give him a week to see if we can call him one of us.
Come this way, please.
What's the problem?
You.
What'll we do now?

[Chuckles]
Anything we want... to the end of time.
The night has its price.
You're not gonna look so good... with your face ripped off.
He makes a kill tonight! I don't care how you do it. You do it or you're done.
And done means dead without guile. It means you'd be real uncomfortable for a looong, looong time.
That's your mama talkin', boy.

[the group has just entered a bar]
Well, I'll be goddamned. Shit-kicker heaven.

[to Caleb]
Park your carcass!
Hey. Hey! You spilled my drink.
Well, why don't you lick it up off the bar, meatball?
There are two ways you can leave these here premises.
Is that a fact?
That's a fact. On your feet or on your back.
That's pretty tough words for a bartender, huh? Gee whiz. If you're not gonna serve me a drink, well... I'll just have to drink his.
[drinks the patron's shot and then spits it on him]
How can you drink that shit?
Just the glass.
Just the glass?
The glass.

[to Jesse]
Don't you want the beer?
No honey, the drink's on me.
[cuts her throat]

[Caleb has been shot]
Am I alive?
[Jesse and Severen laugh]
Hey. You look like 4O miles of rough road!
There's a fly on the ceilin'.
You were here once before, wasn't you? Lots of years back?
Yes, I get through here about once every 5O years. Make me a reservation.

[Caleb has just met his father]
'Round and 'round and 'round she goes. Where she stops, nobody knows.

[Loy has pulled out a gun]
Daddy, put that away. Ain't gonna do no good.
What do you mean, it ain't gonna do no good?
I'd listen to your son.
I'd stop right there if I was you, mister.
Not likely.
[Loy shoots him in the chest, Jesse coughs out the bullet and puts it in Loy's shirt pocket]
For you.
I ain't a person anymore. I don't know what I am. I'm sick!

[after kissing Caleb]
You're warm. Your skin's warm.

Hey, Caleb! I hate to be an indian giver, I really do, but you disappointed me. Now you're gonna have to pay. First, you're gonna give me back my spur. Then I'm gonna knock your tonsils out your asshole. What do you think of them apples, huh?
